command.name: about
command.help:
The about command displays information about the current Symfony project.

The PHP section displays important configuration that could affect your application. The values might
be different between web and CLI.

The Environment section displays the current environment variables managed by Symfony Dotenv. It will not
be shown if no variables were found. The values might be different between web and CLI.

Options:
--help(-h)Display this help message
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug
--version(-V)Display this application version
--ansiForce ANSI output
--no-ansiDisable ANSI output
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question
--env(-e)The Environment name.
--no-debugSwitches off debug mode.

option.name: --verbose
option.help: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

option.name: --no-interaction
option.help: Do not ask any interactive question

command.name: help
command.help:
The help command displays help for a given command:

php D:/dev/php/symfony/symfonycasts/symfony-4-fundementals/bin/console help list

You can also output the help in other formats by using the --format option:

php D:/dev/php/symfony/symfonycasts/symfony-4-fundementals/bin/console help --format=xml list

To display the list of available commands, please use the list command.

Options:
--formatThe output format (txt, xml, json, or md)
--rawTo output raw command help
--help(-h)Display this help message
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug
--version(-V)Display this application version
--ansiForce ANSI output
--no-ansiDisable ANSI output
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question
--env(-e)The Environment name.
--no-debugSwitches off debug mode.

option.name: --format
option.help: The output format (txt, xml, json, or md)

option.name: --verbose
option.help: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

option.name: --no-interaction
option.help: Do not ask any interactive question

command.name: list
command.help:
The list command lists all commands:

php D:/dev/php/symfony/symfonycasts/symfony-4-fundementals/bin/console list

You can also display the commands for a specific namespace:

php D:/dev/php/symfony/symfonycasts/symfony-4-fundementals/bin/console list test

You can also output the information in other formats by using the --format option:

php D:/dev/php/symfony/symfonycasts/symfony-4-fundementals/bin/console list --format=xml

It's also possible to get raw list of commands (useful for embedding command runner):

php D:/dev/php/symfony/symfonycasts/symfony-4-fundementals/bin/console list --raw

Options:
--rawTo output raw command list
--formatThe output format (txt, xml, json, or md)

option.name: --format
option.help: The output format (txt, xml, json, or md)

command.name: assets:install
command.help:
The assets:install command installs bundle assets into a given
directory (e.g. the public directory).

php D:/dev/php/symfony/symfonycasts/symfony-4-fundementals/bin/console assets:install public

A "bundles" directory will be created inside the target directory and the
"Resources/public" directory of each bundle will be copied into it.

To create a symlink to each bundle instead of copying its assets, use the
--symlink option (will fall back to hard copies when symbolic links aren't possible:

php D:/dev/php/symfony/symfonycasts/symfony-4-fundementals/bin/console assets:install public --symlink

To make symlink relative, add the --relative option:

php D:/dev/php/symfony/symfonycasts/symfony-4-fundementals/bin/console assets:install public --symlink --relative


Options:
--symlinkSymlinks the assets instead of copying it
--relativeMake relative symlinks
--help(-h)Display this help message
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug
--version(-V)Display this application version
--ansiForce ANSI output
--no-ansiDisable ANSI output
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question
--env(-e)The Environment name.
--no-debugSwitches off debug mode.

command.name: cache:clear
command.help:
The cache:clear command clears the application cache for a given environment
and debug mode:

php D:/dev/php/symfony/symfonycasts/symfony-4-fundementals/bin/console cache:clear --env=dev
php D:/dev/php/symfony/symfonycasts/symfony-4-fundementals/bin/console cache:clear --env=prod --no-debug

Options:
--no-warmupDo not warm up the cache
--no-optional-warmersSkip optional cache warmers (faster)

--quiet(-q)Do not output any message

--no-ansiDisable ANSI output
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question
--env(-e)The Environment name.
--no-debugSwitches off debug mode.

command.name: cache:pool:clear
command.help:
The cache:pool:clear command clears the given cache pools or cache pool clearers.

command.name: cache:warmup
command.help:
The cache:warmup command warms up the cache.

Before running this command, the cache must be empty.

This command does not generate the classes cache (as when executing this
command, too many classes that should be part of the cache are already loaded
in memory). Use curl or any other similar tool to warm up
the classes cache if you want.


Options:
--no-optional-warmersSkip optional cache warmers (faster)

--quiet(-q)Do not output any message

--no-ansiDisable ANSI output
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question
--env(-e)The Environment name.
--no-debugSwitches off debug mode.

command.name: config:dump-reference
command.help:
The config:dump-reference command dumps the default configuration for an
extension/bundle.

Either the extension alias or bundle name can be used:

php D:/dev/php/symfony/symfonycasts/symfony-4-fundementals/bin/console config:dump-reference framework
php D:/dev/php/symfony/symfonycasts/symfony-4-fundementals/bin/console config:dump-reference FrameworkBundle

With the --format option specifies the format of the configuration,
this is either yaml or xml.
When the option is not provided, yaml is used.

php D:/dev/php/symfony/symfonycasts/symfony-4-fundementals/bin/console config:dump-reference FrameworkBundle --format=xml

For dumping a specific option, add its path as second argument (only available for the yaml format):

php D:/dev/php/symfony/symfonycasts/symfony-4-fundementals/bin/console config:dump-reference framework profiler.matcher


Options:
--formatThe output format (yaml or xml)
--help(-h)Display this help message
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug
--version(-V)Display this application version
--ansiForce ANSI output
--no-ansiDisable ANSI output
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question
--env(-e)The Environment name.
--no-debugSwitches off debug mode.

command.name: debug:autowiring
command.help:
The debug:autowiring command displays all classes and interfaces that
you can use as type-hints for autowiring:

php D:/dev/php/symfony/symfonycasts/symfony-4-fundementals/bin/console debug:autowiring

You can also pass a search term to filter the list:

php D:/dev/php/symfony/symfonycasts/symfony-4-fundementals/bin/console debug:autowiring log


Options:

--quiet(-q)Do not output any message

--no-ansiDisable ANSI output
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question
--env(-e)The Environment name.
--no-debugSwitches off debug mode.

command.name: debug:config
command.help:
The debug:config command dumps the current configuration for an
extension/bundle.

Either the extension alias or bundle name can be used:

php D:/dev/php/symfony/symfonycasts/symfony-4-fundementals/bin/console debug:config framework
php D:/dev/php/symfony/symfonycasts/symfony-4-fundementals/bin/console debug:config FrameworkBundle

For dumping a specific option, add its path as second argument:

php D:/dev/php/symfony/symfonycasts/symfony-4-fundementals/bin/console debug:config framework serializer.enabled


Options:

--quiet(-q)Do not output any message

command.name: debug:container
command.help:
The debug:container command displays all configured public services:

php D:/dev/php/symfony/symfonycasts/symfony-4-fundementals/bin/console debug:container

To get specific information about a service, specify its name:

php D:/dev/php/symfony/symfonycasts/symfony-4-fundementals/bin/console debug:container validator

To see available types that can be used for autowiring, use the --types flag:

php D:/dev/php/symfony/symfonycasts/symfony-4-fundementals/bin/console debug:container --types

By default, private services are hidden. You can display all services by
using the --show-private flag:

php D:/dev/php/symfony/symfonycasts/symfony-4-fundementals/bin/console debug:container --show-private

Use the --tags option to display tagged public services grouped by tag:

php D:/dev/php/symfony/symfonycasts/symfony-4-fundementals/bin/console debug:container --tags

Find all services with a specific tag by specifying the tag name with the --tag option:

php D:/dev/php/symfony/symfonycasts/symfony-4-fundementals/bin/console debug:container --tag=form.type

Use the --parameters option to display all parameters:

php D:/dev/php/symfony/symfonycasts/symfony-4-fundementals/bin/console debug:container --parameters

Display a specific parameter by specifying its name with the --parameter option:

php D:/dev/php/symfony/symfonycasts/symfony-4-fundementals/bin/console debug:container --parameter=kernel.debug


Options:
--show-privateUsed to show public *and* private services
--show-argumentsUsed to show arguments in services
--tagShows all services with a specific tag
--tagsDisplays tagged services for an application
--parameterDisplays a specific parameter for an application
--parametersDisplays parameters for an application
--typesDisplays types (classes/interfaces) available in the container
--formatThe output format (txt, xml, json, or md)
--rawTo output raw description

--quiet(-q)Do not output any message

--version(-V)Display this application version
--ansiForce ANSI output
--no-ansiDisable ANSI output
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question
--env(-e)The Environment name.
--no-debugSwitches off debug mode.

command.name: debug:twig
command.help:
The debug:twig command outputs a list of twig functions,
filters, globals and tests. Output can be filtered with an optional argument.

php D:/dev/php/symfony/symfonycasts/symfony-4-fundementals/bin/console debug:twig

The command lists all functions, filters, etc.

php D:/dev/php/symfony/symfonycasts/symfony-4-fundementals/bin/console debug:twig date

The command lists everything that contains the word date.

php D:/dev/php/symfony/symfonycasts/symfony-4-fundementals/bin/console debug:twig --format=json

The command lists everything in a machine readable json format.

Options:
--formatThe output format (text or json)
--help(-h)Display this help message
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug
--version(-V)Display this application version
--ansiForce ANSI output
--no-ansiDisable ANSI output
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question
--env(-e)The Environment name.
--no-debugSwitches off debug mode.

option.name: --verbose
option.help: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

option.name: --no-interaction
option.help: Do not ask any interactive question

command.name: lint:twig
command.help:
The lint:twig command lints a template and outputs to STDOUT
the first encountered syntax error.

You can validate the syntax of contents passed from STDIN:

cat filename | php D:/dev/php/symfony/symfonycasts/symfony-4-fundementals/bin/console lint:twig

Or the syntax of a file:

php D:/dev/php/symfony/symfonycasts/symfony-4-fundementals/bin/console lint:twig filename

Or of a whole directory:

php D:/dev/php/symfony/symfonycasts/symfony-4-fundementals/bin/console lint:twig dirname
php D:/dev/php/symfony/symfonycasts/symfony-4-fundementals/bin/console lint:twig dirname --format=json

Or all template files in a bundle:

php D:/dev/php/symfony/symfonycasts/symfony-4-fundementals/bin/console lint:twig @AcmeDemoBundle


Options:
--formatThe output format
--help(-h)Display this help message
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug
--version(-V)Display this application version
--ansiForce ANSI output
--no-ansiDisable ANSI output
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question
--env(-e)The Environment name.
--no-debugSwitches off debug mode.

option.name: --verbose
option.help: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

option.name: --no-interaction
option.help: Do not ask any interactive question

command.name: lint:yaml
command.help:
The lint:yaml command lints a YAML file and outputs to STDOUT
the first encountered syntax error.

You can validates YAML contents passed from STDIN:

cat filename | php D:/dev/php/symfony/symfonycasts/symfony-4-fundementals/bin/console lint:yaml

You can also validate the syntax of a file:

php D:/dev/php/symfony/symfonycasts/symfony-4-fundementals/bin/console lint:yaml filename

Or of a whole directory:

php D:/dev/php/symfony/symfonycasts/symfony-4-fundementals/bin/console lint:yaml dirname
php D:/dev/php/symfony/symfonycasts/symfony-4-fundementals/bin/console lint:yaml dirname --format=json

Or find all files in a bundle:

php D:/dev/php/symfony/symfonycasts/symfony-4-fundementals/bin/console lint:yaml @AcmeDemoBundle


Options:
--formatThe output format
--parse-tagsParse custom tags

command.name: router:match
command.help:
The router:match shows which routes match a given request and which don't and for what reason:

php D:/dev/php/symfony/symfonycasts/symfony-4-fundementals/bin/console router:match /foo

or

php D:/dev/php/symfony/symfonycasts/symfony-4-fundementals/bin/console router:match /foo --method POST --scheme https --host symfony.com --verbose


Options:
--methodSets the HTTP method
--schemeSets the URI scheme (usually http or https)
--hostSets the URI host
--help(-h)Display this help message
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug
--version(-V)Display this application version
--ansiForce ANSI output
--no-ansiDisable ANSI output
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question
--env(-e)The Environment name.
--no-debugSwitches off debug mode.

option.help: Sets the URI scheme (usually http or https)

command.name: server:log
command.help:
server:log starts a log server to display in real time the log
messages generated by your application:

php D:/dev/php/symfony/symfonycasts/symfony-4-fundementals/bin/console server:log

To get the information as a machine readable format, use the
--filter option:

php D:/dev/php/symfony/symfonycasts/symfony-4-fundementals/bin/console server:log --filter=port

Options:
--hostThe server host
--formatThe line format
--date-formatThe date format
--filterAn expression to filter log. Example: "level > 200 or channel in ['app', 'doctrine']"
--help(-h)Display this help message
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug
--version(-V)Display this application version
--ansiForce ANSI output
--no-ansiDisable ANSI output
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question
--env(-e)The Environment name.
--no-debugSwitches off debug mode.

option.name: --filter
option.help: An expression to filter log. Example: "level > 200 or channel in ['app', 'doctrine']"

option.name: --verbose
option.help: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

option.name: --no-interaction
option.help: Do not ask any interactive question

command.name: server:run
command.help:
server:run runs a local web server: By default, the server
listens on 127.0.0.1 address and the port number is automatically selected
as the first free port starting from 8000:

D:/dev/php/symfony/symfonycasts/symfony-4-fundementals/bin/console server:run

This command blocks the console. If you want to run other commands, stop it by
pressing Control+C or use the non-blocking server:start
command instead.

Change the default address and port by passing them as an argument:

D:/dev/php/symfony/symfonycasts/symfony-4-fundementals/bin/console server:run 127.0.0.1:8080

Use the --docroot option to change the default docroot directory:

D:/dev/php/symfony/symfonycasts/symfony-4-fundementals/bin/console server:run --docroot=htdocs/

Specify your own router script via the --router option:

D:/dev/php/symfony/symfonycasts/symfony-4-fundementals/bin/console server:run --router=app/config/router.php

See also: http://www.php.net/manual/en/features.commandline.webserver.php

Options:
--docroot(-d)Document root, usually where your front controllers are stored
--router(-r)Path to custom router script
--help(-h)Display this help message
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug
--version(-V)Display this application version
--ansiForce ANSI output
--no-ansiDisable ANSI output
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question
--env(-e)The Environment name.
--no-debugSwitches off debug mode.

option.name: --docroot
option.help: Document root, usually where your front controllers are stored

option.name: --verbose
option.help: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

option.name: --no-interaction
option.help: Do not ask any interactive question

command.name: server:start
command.help:
server:start runs a local web server: By default, the server
listens on 127.0.0.1 address and the port number is automatically selected
as the first free port starting from 8000:

php D:/dev/php/symfony/symfonycasts/symfony-4-fundementals/bin/console server:start

The server is run in the background and you can keep executing other commands.
Execute server:stop to stop it.

Change the default address and port by passing them as an argument:

php D:/dev/php/symfony/symfonycasts/symfony-4-fundementals/bin/console server:start 127.0.0.1:8080

Use the --docroot option to change the default docroot directory:

php D:/dev/php/symfony/symfonycasts/symfony-4-fundementals/bin/console server:start --docroot=htdocs/

Specify your own router script via the --router option:

php D:/dev/php/symfony/symfonycasts/symfony-4-fundementals/bin/console server:start --router=app/config/router.php

See also: http://www.php.net/manual/en/features.commandline.webserver.php

Options:
--docroot(-d)Document root
--router(-r)Path to custom router script
--pidfilePID file
--help(-h)Display this help message
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug
--version(-V)Display this application version
--ansiForce ANSI output
--no-ansiDisable ANSI output
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question
--env(-e)The Environment name.
--no-debugSwitches off debug mode.

option.name: --verbose
option.help: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

option.name: --no-interaction
option.help: Do not ask any interactive question

command.name: server:status
command.help:
server:status shows the details of the given local web
server, such as the address and port where it is listening to:

php D:/dev/php/symfony/symfonycasts/symfony-4-fundementals/bin/console server:status

To get the information as a machine readable format, use the
--filter option:

php D:/dev/php/symfony/symfonycasts/symfony-4-fundementals/bin/console server:status --filter=port

Supported values are port, host, and address.

Options:
--pidfilePID file
--filterThe value to display (one of port, host, or address)
--help(-h)Display this help message
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug
--version(-V)Display this application version
--ansiForce ANSI output
--no-ansiDisable ANSI output
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question
--env(-e)The Environment name.
--no-debugSwitches off debug mode.

option.name: --filter
option.help: The value to display (one of port, host, or address)

option.name: --verbose
option.help: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

option.name: --no-interaction
option.help: Do not ask any interactive question

command.name: server:stop
command.help:
server:stop stops the local web server:

php D:/dev/php/symfony/symfonycasts/symfony-4-fundementals/bin/console server:stop

Options:
--pidfilePID file
--help(-h)Display this help message

--no-ansiDisable ANSI output
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question
--env(-e)The Environment name.
--no-debugSwitches off debug mode.
